title: Nature Nomads
author: David Riva
description: I built an e-commerce platform using the above technologies. The platform allows users to view tours of nature and inspect their details pages. Users can purchase tours using Stripe for payment processing and view their booked tours. The page is fully functional as an e-commerce platform where users can create profiles, book tours with guides, and explore the world! üåé ‚õ∞Ô∏èüåäüå≤

title: Using Dijkstra's Shortest Paths to Route Packets in a Network Overlay
author: David Riva
description:
Designed and implemented a distributed network of N nodes capable of routing packets based on Dijkstra's shortest path algorithm in a simulated network topology.
Implemented communication between nodes using the TCP/IP model, facilitating packet exchange through a custom marshalling and demarshalling system.
Optimized performance by introducing multi-threading for parallel message sending and receiving within each node in the system.

title: Trip Planning Application
author: David Riva & CS314 [Software Development] Teammates
description:
Designed and implemented a comprehensive trip planning and optimization application as a full-stack developer.
Integrated and utilized multiple RESTful APIs across the application's stack to enhance its functionalities.
Demonstrated proficiency in Agile methodologies by following Scrum practices, leading meetings with a team of 4 other students.
Ensured deployment and documentation of the product through bi-monthly releases, ensuring clear and accessible information for users & stakeholders.

title: Plant Disease Classifier
author: David Riva
description: pre-trained CNN on ImageNet used to classify plant diseases.

title: Playing Card Classifier
author: David Riva
description: Custom CNN model for playing card classification.

title: Pong
author: David Riva
description: A simple game of Pong between two players or one-player and a CPU.

title: Sorting Algorithms Visualization
author: David Riva
description: An application that visualizes different sorting algorithms in real-time across random data points. Allows the user to add data points, randomize all data points, select the algorithm to use, step through the sorting algorithm in real-time, and sort all the data points automatically.

title: Email Templating Utility Tool
author: David Riva
description: A Next.js application that allows users to complete a form, which automatically generates a pre-written email in Outlook based on their input. The project was later converted into an Electron.js application for easy distribution, enabling users to add it to their favorites for quick access. It leverages inter-process communication to directly launch Outlook on the user's computer and load the email template seamlessly.
